Weather effects on drills...
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Raising/Training Tips: Weather effects on drills...
By RNA on Tuesday, April 18, 2000 - 12:39 pm:

I did a small analysis of weather effects on drills with a Brown Mask I was raising. I recorded the results of each drill of the same type (The two I used were study and run), and what the weather was like during that week. First off, snow and rain are similar enough to be considered the same, so when I say rain, I mean both.

It seems that there is a weather effect on drills! It is very odd though... when doing drills in the rain, monster seem to score 1-2 points better. However, they are also more likely to fail. When the weather is clear, however, the monster has a much better chance of scoring 'great!' on the drill.

This is by no means canonical. I only recorded about 35 drills, and only with one monster. Different breeds may be affected by different weather, etc etc. I urge anyone else who finds this interesting todo the same, and post your observations here, and what monster you used.

-- B Campbell (oriole@capital.net), September 29, 1999

Answers

I will have to try that, I always wondered if my Durhan would Rush in the rain. Have you noticed that it seems easier to win tournaments if your monster is well rested?

-- Midnight (Steve.p.sharrard@candescent.com), September 30, 1999.
